title: How to Create an Instagram Photo Strip on iPhone or iPad

steps.headline: Open the App Store.
steps.description: It’s the blue icon with a white A in a circle. You’ll usually find it on the home screen.

steps.headline: Tap the magnifying glass icon.
steps.description: This opens the search bar at the top of the screen.

steps.headline: Type insta booth and press the Search key.
steps.description: A list of search results will appear. Insta Booth, the app you need to download, should appear near the top of the list. Insta Booth is free to download.

steps.headline: Tap GET next to Insta Booth.
steps.description: It’s the app with red, yellow, green, and blue camera icon. The GET button will change to INSTALL.

steps.headline: Tap INSTALL.
steps.description: You may have to enter your password or use Touch ID if prompted. Insta Booth will now install to your iPhone or iPad. Once the installation is complete, an Insta Booth icon will be placed on your home screen.

steps.headline: Open Insta Booth.
steps.description: Press the Home button to return to the home screen, then tap the new Insta Booth icon (the red, yellow, green, and blue camera).

steps.headline: Allow Insta Booth permission to access your phone or tablet.
steps.description: The app will need access to your camera and photos to function.

steps.headline: Tap the gallery icon.
steps.description: It’s at the bottom-left corner of the screen and looks like two overlapping squares.

steps.headline: Tap + and select your Instagram album.
steps.description: If your photos are not stored in the Instagram album, choose whichever album contains the photos you want to use. The photos in the album will appear.

steps.headline: Tap the photos you want to add to the photo strip.
steps.description: You can add up to 6 photos, though most photo strips have only 3 or 4. As you tap photos, pink and white check marks will appear at their bottom-right corners.

steps.headline: Tap Create frame.
steps.description: It’s at the bottom-right corner of the screen. This takes you to the editing screen.

steps.headline: Select a photo strip template.
steps.description: Swipe right until you find the template you want to use, then tap it to see a preview. You can choose a vertical or horizontal photo strip template.

steps.headline: Add filters (optional).
steps.description: To add a filter to the entire photo strip, tap Filter, then select a filter.

steps.headline: Add borders (optional).
steps.description: Tap Border at the bottom of the screen to select a color scheme for the lines that surround the photos. The default color is white.

steps.headline: Change the size of the photo strip (optional).
steps.description: To resize the photos in the strip, tap Transform, then select your desired measurements. If you think you'll want to share your photo strip to Instagram, choose one of the Square options.

steps.headline:
Tap {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/4\/49\/Iphoneshare.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/4\/49\/Iphoneshare.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":600,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":991.304347826087,"licensing":"

steps.description: It’s at the top-right corner of the screen. This opens your iPhone or iPad’s sharing options.

steps.headline: Tap Save to Library or select an app for sharing.
steps.description: If you choose to share your photo strip with others, select one of the social media options in the menu. Otherwise, save the photo to your iPhone or iPad to view or share it at any time.

text:
Installing Insta Booth Open the App Store. It’s the blue icon with a white A in a circle. You’ll usually find it on the home screen. Tap the magnifying glass icon. This opens the search bar at the top of the screen. Type insta booth and press the Search key. A list of search results will appear. Insta Booth, the app you need to download, should appear near the top of the list. Insta Booth is free to download. Tap GET next to Insta Booth. It’s the app with red, yellow, green, and blue camera icon. The GET button will change to INSTALL. Tap INSTALL. You may have to enter your password or use Touch ID if prompted. Insta Booth will now install to your iPhone or iPad. Once the installation is complete, an Insta Booth icon will be placed on your home screen. Creating a Photo Strip Open Insta Booth. Press the Home button to return to the home screen, then tap the new Insta Booth icon (the red, yellow, green, and blue camera). Allow Insta Booth permission to access your phone or tablet. The app will need access to your camera and photos to function. Tap the gallery icon. It’s at the bottom-left corner of the screen and looks like two overlapping squares. Tap + and select your Instagram album. If your photos are not stored in the Instagram album, choose whichever album contains the photos you want to use. The photos in the album will appear. Tap the photos you want to add to the photo strip. You can add up to 6 photos, though most photo strips have only 3 or 4. As you tap photos, pink and white check marks will appear at their bottom-right corners. Tap Create frame. It’s at the bottom-right corner of the screen. This takes you to the editing screen. Select a photo strip template. Swipe right until you find the template you want to use, then tap it to see a preview. You can choose a vertical or horizontal photo strip template. Add filters (optional). To add a filter to the entire photo strip, tap Filter, then select a filter. Add borders (optional). Tap Border at the bottom of the screen to select a color scheme for the lines that surround the photos. The default color is white. Change the size of the photo strip (optional). To resize the photos in the strip, tap Transform, then select your desired measurements. If you think you'll want to share your photo strip to Instagram, choose one of the Square options. \n<\/p><\/div>"}. It’s at the top-right corner of the screen. This opens your iPhone or iPad’s sharing options. Tap Save to Library or select an app for sharing. If you choose to share your photo strip with others, select one of the social media options in the menu. Otherwise, save the photo to your iPhone or iPad to view or share it at any time.
